Class SyntaxEditText

  • java.lang.Object

extends EditText

        public void setTextStyle(FontStyle style)

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Set some raw text. In the beginning there is a check whether the object is a lexical analyzer. Then it sends text to the lexical analyzer and receives a stream of tokens, which is based on data about the number of rows in each token, breaks it into an array of strings. Then invokes the method for forming an array of the token string array, which then merges into a single row and set to view.
        Parameters:
        text - Raw text

      • getSelectedLine

        private int getSelectedLine(int pos)
        Returns the row number of the absolute position.
        Parameters:
        pos - Absolute position in text
        Returns:
        Line number

      • resizeLinesOffset

        private void resizeLinesOffset(int fromline,
                               int offset)
        Shifts all the rows from a specified by a certain offset.
        Parameters:
        fromline - String from which the offset
        offset - Shift in characters

      • getStringInLine

      • reSetLine

        private void reSetLine(java.lang.String str,
                       int line)
        It replaces a string in the event of the fact of her change. Checks are not running at the moment whether any stream to replace the strings, if so, it stops and starts a new thread.
        Parameters:
        str - String for change
        line - Line number
